   23: -module(ssh_protocol_SUITE).
   24: 
   25: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   26: -include_lib("kernel/include/inet.hrl").
   27: -include("ssh.hrl").		% ?UINT32, ?BYTE, #ssh{} ...
   28: -include("ssh_transport.hrl").
   29: -include("ssh_auth.hrl").
   30: -include("ssh_test_lib.hrl").
   31: 
   32: -export([
   33:          suite/0,
   34:          all/0,
   35:          groups/0,
   36:          init_per_suite/1,
   37:          end_per_suite/1,
   38:          init_per_testcase/2,
   39:          end_per_testcase/2
   40:         ]).
   41: 
   42: -export([
   43:          bad_long_service_name/1,
   44:          bad_packet_length/2,
   45:          bad_service_name/1,
   46:          bad_service_name/2,
   47:          bad_service_name_length/2,
   48:          bad_service_name_then_correct/1,
   49:          bad_very_long_service_name/1,
   50:          banner_sent_to_client/1,
   51:          banner_not_sent_to_client/1,
   52:          client_handles_keyboard_interactive_0_pwds/1,
   53:          client_handles_banner_keyboard_interactive/1,
   54:          client_info_line/1,
   55:          do_gex_client_init/3,
   56:          do_gex_client_init_old/3,
   57:          empty_service_name/1,
   58:          ext_info_c/1,
   59:          ext_info_s/1,
   60:          kex_strict_negotiated/1,
   61:          kex_strict_msg_ignore/1,
   62:          kex_strict_msg_unknown/1,
   63:          gex_client_init_option_groups/1,
   64:          gex_client_init_option_groups_file/1,
   65:          gex_client_init_option_groups_moduli_file/1,
   66:          gex_client_old_request_exact/1,
   67:          gex_client_old_request_noexact/1,
   68:          gex_server_gex_limit/1,
   69:          lib_match/1,
   70:          lib_no_match/1,
   71:          lib_works_as_client/1,
   72:          lib_works_as_server/1,
   73:          modify_append/1,
   74:          modify_combo/1,
   75:          modify_prepend/1,
   76:          modify_rm/1,
   77:          no_common_alg_client_disconnects/1,
   78:          no_common_alg_server_disconnects/1,
   79:          no_ext_info_s1/1,
   80:          no_ext_info_s2/1,
   81:          packet_length_too_large/1,
   82:          packet_length_too_short/1,
   83:          preferred_algorithms/1,
   84:          service_name_length_too_large/1,
   85:          service_name_length_too_short/1,
   86:          client_close_after_hello/1
   87:         ]).
   88: 
   89: -define(NEWLINE, <<"\r\n">>).
   90: -define(REKEY_DATA_TMO, 65000).
   91: 
   92: -define(DEFAULT_KEX, 'diffie-hellman-group14-sha256').
   93: -define(EXTRA_KEX, 'diffie-hellman-group1-sha1').
   94: 
   95: -define(CIPHERS, ['aes256-ctr','aes192-ctr','aes128-ctr','aes128-cbc','3des-cbc']).
   96: -define(DEFAULT_CIPHERS, (fun() -> Ciphs = filter_supported(cipher, ?CIPHERS),
   97:                                    [{client2server,Ciphs}, {server2client,Ciphs}]
   98:                           end)()
   99:         ).
  100: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  101: %% Common Test interface functions -----------------------------------
  102: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  103: suite() ->
  104:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]},
  105:      {timetrap,{seconds,40}}].
  106: 
  107: all() -> 
  108:     [{group,tool_tests},
  109:      client_info_line,
  110:      {group,kex},
  111:      {group,service_requests},
  112:      {group,authentication},
  113:      {group,packet_size_error},
  114:      {group,field_size_error},
  115:      {group,ext_info},
  116:      {group,preferred_algorithms},
  117:      {group,client_close_early}
  118:     ].
  119: 
  120: groups() ->
  121:     [{tool_tests, [], [lib_works_as_client,
  122: 		       lib_works_as_server,
  123: 		       lib_match,
  124: 		       lib_no_match
  125: 		      ]},
  126:      {packet_size_error, [], [packet_length_too_large,
  127: 			      packet_length_too_short]},
  128:       
  129:      {field_size_error, [], [service_name_length_too_large,
  130: 			     service_name_length_too_short]},
  131:       
  132:      {kex, [], [no_common_alg_server_disconnects,
  133: 		no_common_alg_client_disconnects,
  134: 		gex_client_init_option_groups,
  135: 		gex_server_gex_limit,
  136: 		gex_client_init_option_groups_moduli_file,
  137: 		gex_client_init_option_groups_file,
  138: 		gex_client_old_request_exact,
  139: 		gex_client_old_request_noexact,
  140:                 kex_strict_negotiated,
  141:                 kex_strict_msg_ignore,
  142:                 kex_strict_msg_unknown]},
  143:      {service_requests, [], [bad_service_name,
  144: 			     bad_long_service_name,
  145: 			     bad_very_long_service_name,
  146: 			     empty_service_name,
  147: 			     bad_service_name_then_correct
  148: 			    ]},
  149:      {authentication, [], [client_handles_keyboard_interactive_0_pwds,
  150:                            client_handles_banner_keyboard_interactive,
  151:                            banner_sent_to_client,
  152:                            banner_not_sent_to_client
  153: 			  ]},
  154:      {ext_info, [], [no_ext_info_s1,
  155:                      no_ext_info_s2,
  156:                      ext_info_s,
  157:                      ext_info_c
  158:                     ]},
  159:      {preferred_algorithms, [], [preferred_algorithms,
  160:                                  modify_append,
  161:                                  modify_prepend,
  162:                                  modify_rm,
  163:                                  modify_combo
  164:                                 ]},
  165:      {client_close_early, [], [client_close_after_hello
  166:                                ]}
  167:     ].
  168: 
  169: 
  170: init_per_suite(Config) ->
  171:     ?CHECK_CRYPTO(start_std_daemon( setup_dirs( start_apps(Config)))).
  172: 
  173: end_per_suite(Config) ->
  174:     stop_apps(Config).
  175: 
  176: init_per_testcase(no_common_alg_server_disconnects, Config) ->
  177:     start_std_daemon(Config, [{preferred_algorithms,[{public_key,['ssh-rsa']},
  178:                                                      {cipher,?DEFAULT_CIPHERS}
  179:                                                     ]}]);
  180: init_per_testcase(kex_strict_negotiated, Config) ->
  181:     Config;
  182: init_per_testcase(TC, Config) when TC == gex_client_init_option_groups ;
  183: 				   TC == gex_client_init_option_groups_moduli_file ;
  184: 				   TC == gex_client_init_option_groups_file ;
  185: 				   TC == gex_server_gex_limit ;
  186: 				   TC == gex_client_old_request_exact ;
  187: 				   TC == gex_client_old_request_noexact ->
  188:     Opts = case TC of
  189: 	       gex_client_init_option_groups ->
  190: 		   [{dh_gex_groups, 
  191:                      [{1023, 5, 
  192:                        16#D9277DAA27DB131C03B108D41A76B4DA8ACEECCCAE73D2E48CEDAAA70B09EF9F04FB020DCF36C51B8E485B26FABE0337E24232BE4F4E693548310244937433FB1A5758195DC73B84ADEF8237472C46747D79DC0A2CF8A57CE8DBD8F466A20F8551E7B1B824B2E4987A8816D9BC0741C2798F3EBAD3ADEBCC78FCE6A770E2EC9F
  193:                       }]}];
  194: 	       gex_client_init_option_groups_file ->
  195: 		   DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  196: 		   F = filename:join(DataDir, "dh_group_test"),
  197: 		   [{dh_gex_groups, {file,F}}];
  198: 	       gex_client_init_option_groups_moduli_file ->
  199: 		   DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  200: 		   F = filename:join(DataDir, "dh_group_test.moduli"),
  201: 		   [{dh_gex_groups, {ssh_moduli_file,F}}];
  202: 	       _ when TC == gex_server_gex_limit ;
  203: 		      TC == gex_client_old_request_exact ;
  204: 		      TC == gex_client_old_request_noexact ->
  205: 		    [{dh_gex_groups, 
  206:                       [{1023, 2, 16#D9277DAA27DB131C03B108D41A76B4DA8ACEECCCAE73D2E48CEDAAA70B09EF9F04FB020DCF36C51B8E485B26FABE0337E24232BE4F4E693548310244937433FB1A5758195DC73B84ADEF8237472C46747D79DC0A2CF8A57CE8DBD8F466A20F8551E7B1B824B2E4987A8816D9BC0741C2798F3EBAD3ADEBCC78FCE6A771225323},
  207:                        {1535, 5, 16#D1391174233D315398FE2830AC6B2B66BCCD01B0A634899F339B7879F1DB85712E9DC4E4B1C6C8355570C1D2DCB53493DF18175A9C53D1128B592B4C72D97136F5542FEB981CBFE8012FDD30361F288A42BD5EBB08BAB0A5640E1AC48763B2ABD1945FEE36B2D55E1D50A1C86CED9DD141C4E7BE2D32D9B562A0F8E2E927020E91F58B57EB9ACDDA106A59302D7E92AD5F6E851A45FA1CFE86029A0F727F65A8F475F33572E2FDAB6073F0C21B8B54C3823DB2EF068927E5D747498F96E1E827},
  208:                        {3071, 2, 16#DFAA35D35531E0F524F0099877A482D2AC8D589F374394A262A8E81A8A4FB2F65FADBAB395E05D147B29D486DFAA41F41597A256DA82A8B6F76401AED53D0253F956CEC610D417E42E3B287F7938FC24D8821B40BFA218A956EB7401BED6C96C68C7FD64F8170A8A76B953DD2F05420118F6B144D8FE48060A2BCB85056B478EDEF96DBC70427053ECD2958C074169E9550DD877779A3CF17C5AC850598C7586BEEA9DCFE9DD2A5FB62DF5F33EA7BC00CDA31B9D2DD721F979EA85B6E63F0C4E30BDDCD3A335522F9004C4ED50B15DC537F55324DD4FA119FB3F101467C6D7E1699DE4B3E3C478A8679B8EB3FA5C9B826B44530FD3BE9AD3063B240B0C853EBDDBD68DD940332D98F148D5D9E1DC977D60A0D23D0CA1198637FEAE4E7FAAC173AF2B84313A666CFB4EE6972811921D0AD867CE57F3BBC8D6CB057E3B66757BB46C9F72662624D44E14528327E3A7100E81A12C43C4E236118318CD90C8AA185BBB0C764826DAEAEE8DD245C5B451B4944E6122CC522D1C335C2EEF9429825A2B}
  209:                       ]},
  210:                      {dh_gex_limits, {1023,2000}}
  211: 		    ];
  212: 	       _ ->
  213: 		   []
  214: 	   end,
  215:     start_std_daemon(Config,
  216: 		     [{preferred_algorithms,[{cipher,?DEFAULT_CIPHERS}
  217:                                             ]}
  218: 		      | Opts]);
  219: init_per_testcase(_TestCase, Config) ->
  220:     check_std_daemon_works(Config, ?LINE).
  221: 
  222: end_per_testcase(no_common_alg_server_disconnects, Config) ->
  223:     stop_std_daemon(Config);
  224: end_per_testcase(kex_strict_negotiated, Config) ->
  225:     Config;
  226: end_per_testcase(TC, Config) when TC == gex_client_init_option_groups ;
  227: 				  TC == gex_client_init_option_groups_moduli_file ;
  228: 				  TC == gex_client_init_option_groups_file ;
  229: 				  TC == gex_server_gex_limit ;
  230: 				  TC == gex_client_old_request_exact ;
  231: 				  TC == gex_client_old_request_noexact ->
  232:     stop_std_daemon(Config);
  233: end_per_testcase(_TestCase, Config) ->
  234:     check_std_daemon_works(Config, ?LINE).
  235: 
  236: %%%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  237: %%% Test Cases --------------------------------------------------------
  238: %%%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  239: 
  240: %%%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  241: %%% Connect to an erlang server and check that the testlib acts as a client.
  242: lib_works_as_client(Config) ->
  243:     %% Connect and negotiate keys
  244:     {ok,InitialState} = ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec(
  245: 			  [{set_options, [print_ops, print_seqnums, print_messages]}]
  246: 			 ),
  247:     {ok,AfterKexState} = connect_and_kex(Config, InitialState),
  248: 
  249:     %% Do the authentcation
  250:     {User,Pwd} = server_user_password(Config),
  251:     {ok,EndState} =
  252: 	ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec(
  253: 	  [{send, #ssh_msg_service_request{name = "ssh-userauth"}},
  254: 	   {match, #ssh_msg_service_accept{name = "ssh-userauth"}, receive_msg},
  255: 	   {send, #ssh_msg_userauth_request{user = User,
  256: 					    service = "ssh-connection",
  257: 					    method = "password",
  258: 					    data = <<?BOOLEAN(?FALSE),
  259: 						     ?STRING(unicode:characters_to_binary(Pwd))>>
  260: 					   }},
  261: 	   {match, #ssh_msg_userauth_success{_='_'}, receive_msg}
  262: 	  ], AfterKexState),
  263: 
  264:     %% Disconnect
  265:     {ok,_} =
  266: 	ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec(
  267: 	  [{send, #ssh_msg_disconnect{code = ?SSH_DISCONNECT_BY_APPLICATION,
  268: 				      description = "End of the fun",
  269: 				      language = ""
  270: 				     }},
  271: 	   close_socket
  272: 	  ], EndState).
  273: 
  274: 
  275: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  276: %%% Connect an erlang client and check that the testlib can act as a server.
  277: lib_works_as_server(Config) ->
  278:     {User,_Pwd} = server_user_password(Config),
  279: 
  280:     %% Create a listening socket as server socket:
  281:     {ok,InitialState} = ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec(listen),
  282:     HostPort = ssh_trpt_test_lib:server_host_port(InitialState),
  283: 
  284:     %% Start a process handling one connection on the server side:
  285:     spawn_link(
  286:       fun() ->
  287: 	      {ok,_} =
  288: 		  ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec(
  289: 		    [{set_options, [print_ops, print_messages]},
  290: 		     {accept, [{system_dir, system_dir(Config)},
  291: 			       {user_dir, user_dir(Config)}]},
  292: 		     receive_hello,
  293: 		     {send, hello},
  294: 
  295: 		     {send, ssh_msg_kexinit},
  296: 		     {match, #ssh_msg_kexinit{_='_'}, receive_msg},
  297: 
  298: 		     {match, #ssh_msg_kexdh_init{_='_'}, receive_msg},
  299: 		     {send, ssh_msg_kexdh_reply},
  300: 
  301: 		     {send, #ssh_msg_newkeys{}},
  302: 		     {match,  #ssh_msg_newkeys{_='_'}, receive_msg},
  303: 
  304: 		     {match, #ssh_msg_service_request{name="ssh-userauth"}, receive_msg},
  305: 		     {send, #ssh_msg_service_accept{name="ssh-userauth"}},
  306: 
  307: 		     {match, #ssh_msg_userauth_request{service="ssh-connection",
  308: 						       method="none",
  309: 						       user=User,
  310: 						       _='_'}, receive_msg},
  311: 
  312: 		     {send, #ssh_msg_userauth_failure{authentications = "password",
  313: 						      partial_success = false}},
  314: 
  315: 		     {match, #ssh_msg_userauth_request{service="ssh-connection",
  316: 						       method="password",
  317: 						       user=User,
  318: 						       _='_'}, receive_msg},
  319: 		     {send, #ssh_msg_userauth_success{}},
  320: 		     close_socket,
  321: 		     print_state
  322: 		    ],
  323: 		    InitialState)
  324:       end),
  325: 
  326:     %% and finally connect to it with a regular Erlang SSH client:
  327:     {ok,_} = std_connect(HostPort, Config, 
  328: 			 [{preferred_algorithms,[{kex,[?DEFAULT_KEX]},
  329:                                                  {cipher,?DEFAULT_CIPHERS}
  330:                                                 ]}
  331:                          ]
  332: 			).
  333: 
  334: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  335: %%% Matching
  336: lib_match(_Config) ->
  337:     {ok,_} =
  338: 	ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec([{set_options, [print_ops]},
  339: 				{match, abc, abc},
  340: 				{match, '$a', {cde,fgh}},
  341: 				{match, {cde,fgh}, '$a'},
  342: 				{match, '_', {cde,fgh}},
  343: 				{match, [a,'$a',b], [a,{cde,fgh},b]},
  344: 				{match, [a,'$a'|'$b'], [a,{cde,fgh},b,c]},
  345: 				{match, '$b', [b,c]}
  346: 			       ]).
  347: 
  348: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  349: %%% Not matching
  350: lib_no_match(_Config) ->
  351:     case ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec([{set_options, [print_ops]},
  352: 				 {match, '$x', b},
  353: 				 {match, a, '$x'}])
  354:     of
  355: 	{ok,_} -> {fail,"Unexpected match"};
  356: 	{error, {_Op,{expected,a,b},_State}} -> ok
  357:     end.
  358: 
  359: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  360: %%% Algo negotiation fail.  This should result in a ssh_msg_disconnect
  361: %%% being sent from the server.
  362: no_common_alg_server_disconnects(Config) ->
  363:     {ok,_} =
  364: 	ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec(
  365: 	  [{set_options, [print_ops, {print_messages,detail}]},
  366: 	   {connect,
  367: 	    ssh_test_lib:server_host(Config),ssh_test_lib:server_port(Config),
  368: 	    [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
  369: 	     {user_dir, user_dir(Config)},
  370: 	     {user_interaction, false},
  371: 	     {preferred_algorithms,[{public_key,['ssh-dss']},
  372:                                     {cipher,?DEFAULT_CIPHERS}
  373:                                    ]}
  374: 	    ]},
  375: 	   receive_hello,
  376: 	   {send, hello},
  377: 	   {match, #ssh_msg_kexinit{_='_'}, receive_msg},
  378: 	   {send, ssh_msg_kexinit},  % with server unsupported 'ssh-dss' !
  379: 	   {match, disconnect(), receive_msg}
  380: 	  ]
  381: 	 ).
  382: 
  383: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  384: %%% Algo negotiation fail.  This should result in a ssh_msg_disconnect
  385: %%% being sent from the client.
  386: no_common_alg_client_disconnects(Config) ->
  387:     %% Create a listening socket as server socket:
  388:     {ok,InitialState} = ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec(listen),
  389:     HostPort = ssh_trpt_test_lib:server_host_port(InitialState),
  390:     Parent = self(),
  391: 
  392:     %% Start a process handling one connection on the server side:
  393:     Pid =
  394: 	spawn_link(
  395: 	  fun() ->
  396: 		  Parent !
  397: 		      {result,self(),
  398: 		       ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec(
  399: 			 [{set_options, [print_ops, {print_messages,detail}]},
  400: 			  {accept, [{system_dir, system_dir(Config)},
  401: 				    {user_dir, user_dir(Config)}]},
  402: 			  receive_hello,
  403: 			  {send, hello},
  404: 			  {match, #ssh_msg_kexinit{_='_'}, receive_msg},
  405: 			  {send,  #ssh_msg_kexinit{ % with unsupported "SOME-UNSUPPORTED"
  406: 				     cookie = <<80,158,95,51,174,35,73,130,246,141,200,49,180,190,82,234>>,
  407: 				     kex_algorithms = [atom_to_list(?DEFAULT_KEX)],
  408: 				     server_host_key_algorithms = ["SOME-UNSUPPORTED"],  % SIC!
  409: 				     encryption_algorithms_client_to_server = ["aes128-ctr"],
  410: 				     encryption_algorithms_server_to_client = ["aes128-ctr"],
  411: 				     mac_algorithms_client_to_server = ["hmac-sha2-256"],
  412: 				     mac_algorithms_server_to_client = ["hmac-sha2-256"],
  413: 				     compression_algorithms_client_to_server = ["none"],
  414: 				     compression_algorithms_server_to_client = ["none"],
  415: 				     languages_client_to_server = [],
  416: 				     languages_server_to_client = [],
  417: 				     first_kex_packet_follows = false,
  418: 				     reserved = 0
  419: 				    }},
  420: 			  {match, disconnect(?SSH_DISCONNECT_KEY_EXCHANGE_FAILED), receive_msg}
  421: 			 ],
  422: 			 InitialState)
  423: 		      }
  424: 	  end),
  425: 
  426:     %% and finally connect to it with a regular Erlang SSH client
  427:     %% which of course does not support SOME-UNSUPPORTED as pub key algo:
  428:     Result = std_connect(HostPort, Config, [{preferred_algorithms,[{public_key,['ssh-dss']},
  429:                                                                    {cipher,?DEFAULT_CIPHERS}
  430:                                                                   ]}]),
  431:     ct:log("Result of connect is ~p",[Result]),
  432: 
  433:     receive
  434: 	{result,Pid,{ok,_}} -> 
  435: 	    ok;
  436: 	{result,Pid,{error,{Op,ExecResult,S}}} ->
  437: 	    ct:log("ERROR!~nOp = ~p~nExecResult = ~p~nState =~n~s",
  438: 		   [Op,ExecResult,ssh_trpt_test_lib:format_msg(S)]),
  439: 	    {fail, ExecResult};
  440: 	X -> 
  441: 	    ct:log("¤¤¤¤¤"),
  442: 	    ct:fail(X)
  443:     after 
  444: 	30000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
  445:     end.
  446: 
  447: %%%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  448: gex_client_init_option_groups(Config) ->
  449:     do_gex_client_init(Config, {512, 2048, 4000},
  450: 		       {5,16#D9277DAA27DB131C03B108D41A76B4DA8ACEECCCAE73D2E48CEDAAA70B09EF9F04FB020DCF36C51B8E485B26FABE0337E24232BE4F4E693548310244937433FB1A5758195DC73B84ADEF8237472C46747D79DC0A2CF8A57CE8DBD8F466A20F8551E7B1B824B2E4987A8816D9BC0741C2798F3EBAD3ADEBCC78FCE6A770E2EC9F}

  463: gex_server_gex_limit(Config) ->

  469: 
  470: do_gex_client_init(Config, {Min,N,Max}, {G,P}) ->
  471:     {ok,_} =
  472: 	ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec(
  473: 	  [{set_options, [print_ops, print_seqnums, print_messages]},
  474: 	   {connect,
  475: 	    ssh_test_lib:server_host(Config),ssh_test_lib:server_port(Config),
  476: 	    [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
  477: 	     {user_dir, user_dir(Config)},
  478: 	     {user_interaction, false},
  479: 	     {preferred_algorithms,[{kex,['diffie-hellman-group-exchange-sha256']},
  480:                                     {cipher,?DEFAULT_CIPHERS}
  481:                                    ]}
  482: 	    ]},
  483: 	   receive_hello,
  484: 	   {send, hello},
  485: 	   {send, ssh_msg_kexinit},
  486: 	   {match, #ssh_msg_kexinit{_='_'}, receive_msg},
  487: 	   {send, #ssh_msg_kex_dh_gex_request{min = Min, 
  488: 					      n = N,
  489: 					      max = Max}},
  490: 	   {match, #ssh_msg_kex_dh_gex_group{p=P, g=G, _='_'},  receive_msg}
  491: 	  ]
  492: 	 ).
  493: 
  494: %%%--------------------------------------------------------------------

  498:                            ).

  503:                            ).

  513: 	     {user_interaction, false},
  514: 	     {preferred_algorithms,[{kex,['diffie-hellman-group-exchange-sha256']},
  515:                                     {cipher,?DEFAULT_CIPHERS}
  516:                                    ]}
  517: 	    ]},
  518: 	   receive_hello,

  527: %%%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  528: bad_service_name(Config) -> 
  529:     bad_service_name(Config, "kfglkjf").
  530:     
  531: bad_long_service_name(Config) -> 
  532:     bad_service_name(Config, 
  533: 		     lists:duplicate(?SSH_MAX_PACKET_SIZE div 2, $a)).
  534: 
  535: bad_very_long_service_name(Config) -> 
  536:     bad_service_name(Config,
  537: 		     lists:duplicate(?SSH_MAX_PACKET_SIZE+5, $a)).
  538: 
  539: empty_service_name(Config) ->
  540:     bad_service_name(Config, "").
  541:     
  542: bad_service_name_then_correct(Config) ->
  543:     {ok,InitialState} = connect_and_kex(Config),
  544:     {ok,_} =
  545: 	ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec(
  546: 	  [{set_options, [print_ops, print_seqnums, print_messages]},
  547: 	   {send, #ssh_msg_service_request{name = "kdjglkfdjgkldfjglkdfjglkfdjglkj"}},
  548: 	   {send, #ssh_msg_service_request{name = "ssh-connection"}},
  549: 	   {match, disconnect(), receive_msg}
  550: 	   ], InitialState).
  551: 
  552: 
  553: bad_service_name(Config, Name) ->
  554:     {ok,InitialState} = connect_and_kex(Config),
  555:     {ok,_} =
  556: 	ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec(
  557: 	  [{set_options, [print_ops, print_seqnums, print_messages]},
  558: 	   {send, #ssh_msg_service_request{name = Name}},
  559: 	   {match, disconnect(), receive_msg}
  560: 	  ], InitialState).
  561: 
  562: %%%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  563: packet_length_too_large(Config) -> bad_packet_length(Config, +4).
  564: 
  565: packet_length_too_short(Config) -> bad_packet_length(Config, -4).
  566:     
  567: bad_packet_length(Config, LengthExcess) ->
  568:     PacketFun = 
  569: 	fun(Msg, Ssh) ->
  570: 		BinMsg = ssh_message:encode(Msg),
  571: 		ssh_transport:pack(BinMsg, Ssh, LengthExcess)
  572: 	end,
  573:     {ok,InitialState} = connect_and_kex(Config),
  574:     {ok,_} =
  575: 	ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec(
  576: 	  [{set_options, [print_ops, print_seqnums, print_messages]},
  577: 	   {send, {special,
  578: 		   #ssh_msg_service_request{name="ssh-userauth"},
  579: 		   PacketFun}},
  580: 	   %% Prohibit remote decoder starvation:	   
  581: 	   {send, #ssh_msg_service_request{name="ssh-userauth"}},
  582: 	   {match, disconnect(), receive_msg}
  583: 	  ], InitialState).
  584: 
  585: %%%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  586: service_name_length_too_large(Config) -> bad_service_name_length(Config, +4).
  587: 
  588: service_name_length_too_short(Config) -> bad_service_name_length(Config, -4).
  589: 
  590: 
  591: bad_service_name_length(Config, LengthExcess) ->
  592:     PacketFun = 
  593: 	fun(#ssh_msg_service_request{name=Service}, Ssh) ->
  594: 		BinName = list_to_binary(Service),
  595: 		BinMsg = 
  596: 		    <<?BYTE(?SSH_MSG_SERVICE_REQUEST),
  597: 		      %% A bad string encoding of Service:
  598: 		      ?UINT32(size(BinName)+LengthExcess), BinName/binary
  599: 		    >>,
  600: 		ssh_transport:pack(BinMsg, Ssh)
  601: 	end,
  602:     {ok,InitialState} = connect_and_kex(Config),
  603:     {ok,_} =
  604: 	ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec(
  605: 	  [{set_options, [print_ops, print_seqnums, print_messages]},
  606: 	   {send, {special,
  607: 		   #ssh_msg_service_request{name="ssh-userauth"}, 
  608: 		   PacketFun} },
  609: 	   %% Prohibit remote decoder starvation:	   
  610: 	   {send, #ssh_msg_service_request{name="ssh-userauth"}},
  611: 	   {match, disconnect(), receive_msg}
  612: 	  ], InitialState).
  613:     
  614: %%%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  615: %%% This is due to a fault report (OTP-13255) with OpenSSH-6.6.1
  616: client_handles_keyboard_interactive_0_pwds(Config) ->
  617:     {User,_Pwd} = server_user_password(Config),
  618: 
  619:     %% Create a listening socket as server socket:
  620:     {ok,InitialState} = ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec(listen),
  621:     HostPort = ssh_trpt_test_lib:server_host_port(InitialState),
  622: 
  623:     %% Start a process handling one connection on the server side:
  624:     spawn_link(
  625:       fun() ->
  626: 	      {ok,_} =
  627: 		  ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec(
  628: 		    [{set_options, [print_ops, print_messages]},
  629: 		     {accept, [{system_dir, system_dir(Config)},
  630: 			       {user_dir, user_dir(Config)}]},
  631: 		     receive_hello,
  632: 		     {send, hello},
  633: 
  634: 		     {send, ssh_msg_kexinit},
  635: 		     {match, #ssh_msg_kexinit{_='_'}, receive_msg},
  636: 
  637: 		     {match, #ssh_msg_kexdh_init{_='_'}, receive_msg},
  638: 		     {send, ssh_msg_kexdh_reply},
  639: 
  640: 		     {send, #ssh_msg_newkeys{}},
  641: 		     {match,  #ssh_msg_newkeys{_='_'}, receive_msg},
  642: 
  643: 		     {match, #ssh_msg_service_request{name="ssh-userauth"}, receive_msg},
  644: 		     {send, #ssh_msg_service_accept{name="ssh-userauth"}},
  645: 
  646: 		     {match, #ssh_msg_userauth_request{service="ssh-connection",
  647: 						       method="none",
  648: 						       user=User,
  649: 						       _='_'}, receive_msg},
  650: 		     {send, #ssh_msg_userauth_failure{authentications = "keyboard-interactive",
  651: 						      partial_success = false}},
  652: 		     
  653: 		     {match, #ssh_msg_userauth_request{service="ssh-connection",
  654: 						       method="keyboard-interactive",
  655: 						       user=User,
  656: 						       _='_'}, receive_msg},
  657: 		     {send, #ssh_msg_userauth_info_request{name = "",
  658: 							   instruction = "",
  659: 							   language_tag = "",
  660: 							   num_prompts = 1,
  661: 							   data = <<0,0,0,10,80,97,115,115,119,111,114,100,58,32,0>>
  662: 							  }},
  663: 		     {match, #ssh_msg_userauth_info_response{num_responses = 1,
  664: 							     _='_'}, receive_msg},
  665: 		      
  666: 		     %% the next is strange, but openssh 6.6.1 does this and this is what this testcase is about
  667: 		     {send, #ssh_msg_userauth_info_request{name = "",
  668: 							   instruction = "",
  669: 							   language_tag = "",
  670: 							   num_prompts = 0,
  671: 							   data = <<>>
  672: 							  }},
  673: 		     {match, #ssh_msg_userauth_info_response{num_responses = 0,
  674: 							     data = <<>>,
  675: 							     _='_'}, receive_msg},
  676: 		     %% Here we know that the tested fault is fixed
  677: 		     {send, #ssh_msg_userauth_success{}},
  678: 		     close_socket,
  679: 		     print_state
  680: 		    ],
  681: 		    InitialState)
  682:       end),
  683: 
  684:     %% and finally connect to it with a regular Erlang SSH client:
  685:     {ok,_} = std_connect(HostPort, Config, 
  686: 			 [{preferred_algorithms,[{kex,[?DEFAULT_KEX]},
  687:                                                  {cipher,?DEFAULT_CIPHERS}
  688:                                                 ]}]
  689: 			).
  690: 
  691: %%%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  692: %%% SSH_MSG_USERAUTH_BANNER can be sent at any time during user auth.
  693: %%% The following test mimics a SSH server implementation that sends the banner
  694: %%% immediately before sending SSH_MSG_USERAUTH_SUCCESS.
  695: client_handles_banner_keyboard_interactive(Config) ->
  696:     {User,_Pwd} = server_user_password(Config),
  697: 
  698:     %% Create a listening socket as server socket:
  699:     {ok,InitialState} = ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec(listen),
  700:     HostPort = ssh_trpt_test_lib:server_host_port(InitialState),
  701: 
  702:     %% Start a process handling one connection on the server side:
  703:     spawn_link(
  704:       fun() ->
  705: 	      {ok,_} =
  706: 		  ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec(
  707: 		    [{set_options, [print_ops, print_messages]},
  708: 		     {accept, [{system_dir, system_dir(Config)},
  709: 			       {user_dir, user_dir(Config)}]},
  710: 		     receive_hello,
  711: 		     {send, hello},
  712: 
  713: 		     {send, ssh_msg_kexinit},
  714: 		     {match, #ssh_msg_kexinit{_='_'}, receive_msg},
  715: 
  716: 		     {match, #ssh_msg_kexdh_init{_='_'}, receive_msg},
  717: 		     {send, ssh_msg_kexdh_reply},
  718: 
  719: 		     {send, #ssh_msg_newkeys{}},
  720: 		     {match,  #ssh_msg_newkeys{_='_'}, receive_msg},
  721: 
  722: 		     {match, #ssh_msg_service_request{name="ssh-userauth"}, receive_msg},
  723: 		     {send, #ssh_msg_service_accept{name="ssh-userauth"}},
  724: 
  725: 		     {match, #ssh_msg_userauth_request{service="ssh-connection",
  726: 						       method="none",
  727: 						       user=User,
  728: 						       _='_'}, receive_msg},
  729: 		     {send, #ssh_msg_userauth_failure{authentications = "keyboard-interactive",
  730: 						      partial_success = false}},
  731: 
  732: 		     {match, #ssh_msg_userauth_request{service="ssh-connection",
  733: 						       method="keyboard-interactive",
  734: 						       user=User,
  735: 						       _='_'}, receive_msg},
  736: 		     {send, #ssh_msg_userauth_info_request{name = "",
  737: 							   instruction = "",
  738: 							   language_tag = "",
  739: 							   num_prompts = 1,
  740: 							   data = <<0,0,0,10,80,97,115,115,119,111,114,100,58,32,0>>
  741: 							  }},
  742: 		     {match, #ssh_msg_userauth_info_response{num_responses = 1,
  743: 							     _='_'}, receive_msg},
  744: 		     {send, #ssh_msg_userauth_info_request{name = "",
  745: 							   instruction = "",
  746: 							   language_tag = "",
  747: 							   num_prompts = 0,
  748: 							   data = <<>>
  749: 							  }},
  750: 		     {match, #ssh_msg_userauth_info_response{num_responses = 0,
  751: 							     data = <<>>,
  752: 							     _='_'}, receive_msg},
  753:                      {send, #ssh_msg_userauth_banner{message = "Banner\n"}},
  754: 		     {send, #ssh_msg_userauth_success{}},
  755: 		     close_socket,
  756: 		     print_state
  757: 		    ],
  758: 		    InitialState)
  759:       end),
  760: 
  761:     %% and finally connect to it with a regular Erlang SSH client:
  762:     {ok,_} = std_connect(HostPort, Config,
  763: 			 [{preferred_algorithms,[{kex,[?DEFAULT_KEX]},
  764:                                                  {cipher,?DEFAULT_CIPHERS}
  765:                                                 ]}]
  766: 			).
  767: 
  768: banner_sent_to_client(Config) ->
  769:     BannerFun = fun(U) -> list_to_binary(U) end,
  770:     User = "foo",
  771:     Pwd = "morot",
  772:     UserDir = user_dir(Config),
  773:     {Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, system_dir(Config)},
  774: 					     {user_dir, UserDir},
  775: 					     {password, Pwd},
  776: 					     {failfun, fun ssh_test_lib:failfun/2},
  777: 					     {bannerfun, BannerFun}]),
  778: 
  779:     {ok,AfterUserAuthReqState} = connect_and_userauth_request(Host, Port, User, Pwd, UserDir),
  780:     {ok,EndState} =
  781: 	ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec(
  782: 	  [{match, #ssh_msg_userauth_banner{message = BannerFun(User),
  783:                                             language = <<>>}, receive_msg},
  784: 	   {match, #ssh_msg_userauth_success{_='_'}, receive_msg}
  785: 	  ], AfterUserAuthReqState),
  786: 
  787:     {ok,_} = trpt_test_lib_send_disconnect(EndState),
  788: 
  789:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid),
  790:     Config.
  791: 
  792: banner_not_sent_to_client(Config) ->
  793:     %% Bad bannerfun
  794:     BBF = fun(_U) -> no_banner_is_sent_because_bannerfun_return_is_not_binary end,
  795:     User = "foo",
  796:     Pwd = "morot",
  797:     UserDir = user_dir(Config),
  798:     {BBFPid, BBFHost, BBFPort} =
  799:         ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, system_dir(Config)},
  800:                              {user_dir, UserDir},
  801:                              {password, Pwd},
  802:                              {failfun, fun ssh_test_lib:failfun/2},
  803:                              {bannerfun, BBF}]),
  804: 
  805:     {ok,BBFAfterUserAuthReqState} = connect_and_userauth_request(BBFHost,
  806:                                                                  BBFPort,
  807:                                                                  User, Pwd, UserDir),
  808:     {ok,BBFEndState} =
  809: 	ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec(
  810: 	  [{match, #ssh_msg_userauth_success{_='_'}, receive_msg}
  811: 	  ], BBFAfterUserAuthReqState),
  812: 
  813:     {ok,_} = trpt_test_lib_send_disconnect(BBFEndState),
  814:     ssh:stop_daemon(BBFPid),
  815: 
  816:     %% No bannerfun
  817:     {Pid, Host, Port} =
  818:         ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, system_dir(Config)},
  819:                              {user_dir, UserDir},
  820:                              {password, Pwd},
  821:                              {failfun, fun ssh_test_lib:failfun/2}]),
  822: 
  823:     {ok,AfterUserAuthReqState} = connect_and_userauth_request(Host,
  824:                                                               Port,
  825:                                                               User, Pwd, UserDir),
  826:     {ok,EndState} =
  827: 	ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec(
  828: 	  [{match, #ssh_msg_userauth_success{_='_'}, receive_msg}
  829: 	  ], AfterUserAuthReqState),
  830: 
  831:     {ok,_} = trpt_test_lib_send_disconnect(EndState),
  832:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid),
  833: 
  834:     Config.
  835: 
  836: %%%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  837: client_info_line(Config) ->
  838:     %% A client must not send an info-line. If it does, the server should handle
  839:     %% handle this gracefully
  840:     {ok,Pid} = ssh_eqc_event_handler:add_report_handler(),
  841:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  842:     {_, _, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir,DataDir}]),
  843: 
  844:     %% Fake client:
  845:     {ok,S} = gen_tcp:connect("localhost",Port,[]),
  846:     gen_tcp:send(S,"An illegal info-string\r\n"),
  847:     gen_tcp:close(S),
  848: 
  849:     %% wait for server to react:
  850:     timer:sleep(1000),
  851: 
  852:     %% check if a badmatch was received:
  853:     {ok, Reports} = ssh_eqc_event_handler:get_reports(Pid),
  854:     case lists:any(fun({error_report,_,{_,supervisor_report,L}}) when is_list(L) -> 
  855: 			   lists:member({reason,{badmatch,{error,closed}}}, L);
  856: 		      (_) ->
  857: 			   false
  858: 		   end, Reports) of
  859: 	true ->
  860: 	    ct:fail("Bad error report on info_line from client");
  861: 	false ->
  862: 	    ok
  863:     end.
  864: 	
  865: %%%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  866: %%% The server does not send the extension because
  867: %%% the client does not tell the server to send it
  868: no_ext_info_s1(Config) ->
  869:     %% Start the daemon
  870:     Server = {Pid,_,_} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{send_ext_info,true},
  871:                                               {system_dir, system_dir(Config)}]),
  872:     {ok,AfterKexState} = connect_and_kex([{server,Server}|Config]),
  873:     {ok,_} = 
  874:         ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec(
  875:           [{send, #ssh_msg_service_request{name = "ssh-userauth"}},
  876: 	   {match, #ssh_msg_service_accept{name = "ssh-userauth"}, receive_msg}
  877:           ], AfterKexState),
  878:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
  879: 
  880: %%%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  881: %%% The server does not send the extension because
  882: %%% the server is not configured to send it
  883: no_ext_info_s2(Config) ->    
  884:     %% Start the daemon
  885:     Server = {Pid,_,_} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{send_ext_info,false},
  886:                                               {system_dir, system_dir(Config)}]),
  887:     {ok,AfterKexState} = connect_and_kex([{extra_options,[{recv_ext_info,true}]},
  888:                                           {server,Server}
  889:                                           | Config]),
  890:     {ok,_} =
  891:         ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec(
  892:           [{send, #ssh_msg_service_request{name = "ssh-userauth"}},
  893: 	   {match, #ssh_msg_service_accept{name = "ssh-userauth"}, receive_msg}
  894:           ], AfterKexState),
  895:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
  896: 
  897: %%%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  898: %%% The server sends the extension
  899: ext_info_s(Config) ->    
  900:     %% Start the daemon
  901:     Server = {Pid,_,_} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{send_ext_info,true},
  902:                                               {system_dir, system_dir(Config)}]),
  903:     {ok,AfterKexState} = connect_and_kex([{extra_options,[{recv_ext_info,true}]},
  904:                                           {server,Server}
  905:                                           | Config]),
  906:     {ok,_} =
  907:         ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec(
  908:           [{match, #ssh_msg_ext_info{_='_'}, receive_msg}
  909:           ],
  910:           AfterKexState),
  911:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
  912: 
  913: %%%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  914: %%% The client sends the extension
  915: ext_info_c(Config) ->    
  916:     %% Create a listening socket as server socket:
  917:     {ok,InitialState} = ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec(listen),
  918:     HostPort = ssh_trpt_test_lib:server_host_port(InitialState),
  919: 
  920:     Parent = self(),
  921:     %% Start a process handling one connection on the server side:
  922:     Pid =
  923:         spawn_link(
  924:           fun() ->
  925:                   Result =
  926:                       ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec(
  927:                         [{set_options, [print_ops, print_messages]},
  928:                          {accept, [{system_dir, system_dir(Config)},
  929:                                    {user_dir, user_dir(Config)},
  930:                                    {recv_ext_info, true}
  931:                                   ]},
  932:                          receive_hello,
  933:                          {send, hello},
  934:                          
  935:                          {send, ssh_msg_kexinit},
  936:                          {match, #ssh_msg_kexinit{_='_'}, receive_msg},
  937:                          
  938:                          {match, #ssh_msg_kexdh_init{_='_'}, receive_msg},
  939:                          {send, ssh_msg_kexdh_reply},
  940: 
  941:                          {send, #ssh_msg_newkeys{}},
  942:                          {match,  #ssh_msg_newkeys{_='_'}, receive_msg},
  943: 
  944:                          {match, #ssh_msg_ext_info{_='_'}, receive_msg},
  945: 
  946:                          close_socket,
  947:                          print_state
  948:                         ],
  949:                         InitialState),
  950:                   Parent ! {result,self(),Result}
  951:           end),
  952: 
  953:     %% connect to it with a regular Erlang SSH client
  954:     %% (expect error due to the close_socket in daemon):
  955:     {error,_} = std_connect(HostPort, Config, 
  956:                             [{preferred_algorithms,[{kex,[?DEFAULT_KEX]},
  957:                                                     {cipher,?DEFAULT_CIPHERS}
  958:                                                    ]},
  959:                              {tstflg, [{ext_info_client,true}]},
  960:                              {send_ext_info, true}
  961:                             ]
  962:                            ),
  963:     
  964:     %% Check that the daemon got expected result:
  965:     receive
  966:         {result, Pid, {ok,_}} -> ok;
  967:         {result, Pid, Error} -> ct:fail("Error: ~p",[Error])
  968:     end.
  969: 
  970: %%%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  971: %%%
  972: kex_strict_negotiated(Config0) ->
  973:     {ok, TestRef} = ssh_test_lib:add_log_handler(),
  974:     Config = start_std_daemon(Config0, []),
  975:     {Server, Host, Port} = proplists:get_value(server, Config),
  976:     Level = ssh_test_lib:get_log_level(),
  977:     ssh_test_lib:set_log_level(debug),
  978:     {ok, ConnRef} = std_connect({Host, Port}, Config, []),
  979:     {algorithms, _A} = ssh:connection_info(ConnRef, algorithms),
  980:     ssh:stop_daemon(Server),
  981:     {ok, Events} = ssh_test_lib:get_log_events(TestRef),
  982:     true = ssh_test_lib:kex_strict_negotiated(client, Events),
  983:     true = ssh_test_lib:kex_strict_negotiated(server, Events),
  984:     ssh_test_lib:set_log_level(Level),
  985:     ssh_test_lib:rm_log_handler(),
  986:     ok.
  987: 
  988: %% Connect to an erlang server and inject unexpected SSH ignore
  989: kex_strict_msg_ignore(Config) ->
  990:     ct:log("START: ~p~n=================================", [?FUNCTION_NAME]),
  991:     ExpectedReason = "strict KEX violation: unexpected SSH_MSG_IGNORE",
  992:     TestMessages =
  993:         [{send, ssh_msg_ignore},
  994:          {match, #ssh_msg_kexdh_reply{_='_'}, receive_msg},
  995:          {match, disconnect(?SSH_DISCONNECT_KEY_EXCHANGE_FAILED), receive_msg}],
  996:     kex_strict_helper(Config, TestMessages, ExpectedReason).
  997: 
  998: %% Connect to an erlang server and inject unexpected non-SSH binary
  999: kex_strict_msg_unknown(Config) ->
 1000:     ct:log("START: ~p~n=================================", [?FUNCTION_NAME]),
 1001:     ExpectedReason = "Bad packet: Size",
 1002:     TestMessages =
 1003:         [{send, ssh_msg_unknown},
 1004:          {match, #ssh_msg_kexdh_reply{_='_'}, receive_msg},
 1005:          {match, disconnect(?SSH_DISCONNECT_KEY_EXCHANGE_FAILED), receive_msg}],
 1006:     kex_strict_helper(Config, TestMessages, ExpectedReason).
 1007: 
 1008: kex_strict_helper(Config, TestMessages, ExpectedReason) ->
 1009:     {ok, TestRef} = ssh_test_lib:add_log_handler(),
 1010:     Level = ssh_test_lib:get_log_level(),
 1011:     ssh_test_lib:set_log_level(debug),
 1012:     %% Connect and negotiate keys
 1013:     {ok, InitialState} = ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec(
 1014: 			  [{set_options, [print_ops, print_seqnums, print_messages]}]
 1015: 			 ),
 1016:     {ok, _AfterKexState} =
 1017:         ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec(
 1018:           [{connect,
 1019:             ssh_test_lib:server_host(Config),ssh_test_lib:server_port(Config),
 1020:             [{preferred_algorithms,[{kex,[?DEFAULT_KEX]},
 1021:                                     {cipher,?DEFAULT_CIPHERS}
 1022:                                    ]},
 1023:              {silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1024:              {recv_ext_info, false},
 1025:              {user_dir, user_dir(Config)},
 1026:              {user_interaction, false}
 1027:             | proplists:get_value(extra_options,Config,[])
 1028:             ]},
 1029:            receive_hello,
 1030:            {send, hello},
 1031:            {send, ssh_msg_kexinit},
 1032:            {match, #ssh_msg_kexinit{_='_'}, receive_msg},
 1033:            {send, ssh_msg_kexdh_init}] ++
 1034:               TestMessages,
 1035:           InitialState),
 1036:     ct:sleep(100),
 1037:     {ok, Events} = ssh_test_lib:get_log_events(TestRef),
 1038:     ssh_test_lib:rm_log_handler(),
 1039:     ct:log("Events = ~p", [Events]),
 1040:     true = ssh_test_lib:kex_strict_negotiated(client, Events),
 1041:     true = ssh_test_lib:kex_strict_negotiated(server, Events),
 1042:     true = ssh_test_lib:event_logged(server, Events, ExpectedReason),
 1043:     ssh_test_lib:set_log_level(Level),
 1044:     ok.
 1045: 
 1046: %%%----------------------------------------------------------------
 1047: %%%
 1048: preferred_algorithms(Config) ->
 1049:     Ciphers = filter_supported(cipher, ?CIPHERS),
 1050:     {error,{eoptions,{{preferred_algorithms,{kex,[some_unknown_algo]}},
 1051:                       "Unsupported value(s) found"}}} =
 1052:         chk_pref_algs(Config,
 1053:                       [?DEFAULT_KEX],
 1054:                       Ciphers,
 1055:                       [{preferred_algorithms, [{kex,[some_unknown_algo,?DEFAULT_KEX]},
 1056:                                                {cipher,Ciphers}
 1057:                                               ]}
 1058:                       ]).
 1059: 
 1060: %%%----------------------------------------------------------------
 1061: %%%
 1062: modify_append(Config) ->
 1063:     Ciphers = filter_supported(cipher, ?CIPHERS),
 1064:     {ok,_} =
 1065:         chk_pref_algs(Config,
 1066:                       [?DEFAULT_KEX, ?EXTRA_KEX, list_to_atom(?kex_strict_s)],
 1067:                       Ciphers,
 1068:                       [{preferred_algorithms, [{kex,[?DEFAULT_KEX]},
 1069:                                                {cipher,Ciphers}
 1070:                                               ]},
 1071:                        {modify_algorithms, [{append,[{kex,[some_unknown_algo,?EXTRA_KEX]}]}]}
 1072:                       ]).
 1073: 
 1074: %%%----------------------------------------------------------------
 1075: %%%
 1076: modify_prepend(Config) ->
 1077:     Ciphers = filter_supported(cipher, ?CIPHERS),
 1078:     {ok,_} =
 1079:         chk_pref_algs(Config,
 1080:                       [?EXTRA_KEX, ?DEFAULT_KEX, list_to_atom(?kex_strict_s)],
 1081:                       Ciphers,
 1082:                       [{preferred_algorithms, [{kex,[?DEFAULT_KEX]},
 1083:                                                {cipher,Ciphers}
 1084:                                               ]},
 1085:                        {modify_algorithms, [{prepend,[{kex,[some_unknown_algo,?EXTRA_KEX]}]}]}
 1086:                       ]).
 1087: 
 1088: %%%----------------------------------------------------------------
 1089: %%%
 1090: modify_rm(Config) ->
 1091:     Ciphers = filter_supported(cipher, ?CIPHERS),
 1092:     {ok,_} =
 1093:         chk_pref_algs(Config,
 1094:                       [?DEFAULT_KEX, list_to_atom(?kex_strict_s)],
 1095:                       tl(Ciphers),
 1096:                       [{preferred_algorithms, [{kex,[?DEFAULT_KEX,?EXTRA_KEX]},
 1097:                                                {cipher,Ciphers}
 1098:                                               ]},
 1099:                        {modify_algorithms, [{rm,[{kex,[some_unknown_algo,?EXTRA_KEX]},
 1100:                                                  {cipher,[hd(Ciphers)]}
 1101:                                                 ]}
 1102:                                            ]}
 1103:                       ]).
 1104: 
 1105: 
 1106: %%%----------------------------------------------------------------
 1107: %%%
 1108: modify_combo(Config) ->
 1109:     Ciphers = filter_supported(cipher, ?CIPHERS),
 1110:     LastC = lists:last(Ciphers),
 1111:     {ok,_} =
 1112:         chk_pref_algs(Config,
 1113:                       [?DEFAULT_KEX, list_to_atom(?kex_strict_s)],
 1114:                       [LastC] ++ (tl(Ciphers)--[LastC]) ++ [hd(Ciphers)],
 1115:                       [{preferred_algorithms, [{kex,[?DEFAULT_KEX,?EXTRA_KEX]},
 1116:                                                {cipher,Ciphers}
 1117:                                               ]},
 1118:                        {modify_algorithms, [{rm,[{kex,[some_unknown_algo,?EXTRA_KEX]}
 1119:                                                 ]},
 1120:                                             {prepend,[{cipher,[{server2client,[LastC]}]}
 1121:                                                      ]},
 1122:                                             {append,[{cipher,[a,hd(Ciphers),b]}
 1123:                                                     ]}
 1124:                                            ]}
 1125:                       ]).
 1126: 
 1127: 
 1128: %%%----------------------------------------------------------------
 1129: %%%
 1130: client_close_after_hello(Config0) ->
 1131:     MaxSessions = 20,
 1132:     SleepSec = 15,
 1133:     Config = start_std_daemon(Config0, [{parallel_login,true},
 1134:                                         {max_sessions,MaxSessions},
 1135:                                         {negotiation_timeout,SleepSec*1000}
 1136:                                        ]),
 1137:     {_Parents0, Conns0, []} =
 1138:         ssh_test_lib:find_handshake_parent(ssh_test_lib:server_port(Config)),
 1139:     Cs =
 1140:         [ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec(
 1141:            [{connect,
 1142:              ssh_test_lib:server_host(Config),ssh_test_lib:server_port(Config),
 1143:              [{preferred_algorithms,[{kex,[?DEFAULT_KEX]},
 1144:                                      {cipher,?DEFAULT_CIPHERS}
 1145:                                     ]},
 1146:               {silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1147:               {recv_ext_info, false},
 1148:               {user_dir, user_dir(Config)},
 1149:               {user_interaction, false}
 1150:               | proplists:get_value(extra_options,Config,[])
 1151:              ]},
 1152:             {send, hello}
 1153:            ]) || _ <- lists:seq(1,MaxSessions+100)],
 1154:     ct:log("=== Tried to start ~p sessions.", [length(Cs)]),
 1155:     ssh_info:print(fun ct:log/2),
 1156:     {Parents, Conns, Handshakers} =
 1157:         ssh_test_lib:find_handshake_parent(ssh_test_lib:server_port(Config)),
 1158:     ct:log("Found (Port=~p):~n"
 1159:            "  Connections  (length ~p): ~p~n"
 1160:            "  Handshakers  (length ~p): ~p~n"
 1161:            "  with parents (length ~p): ~p",
 1162:            [ssh_test_lib:server_port(Config),
 1163:             length(Conns), Conns,
 1164:             length(Handshakers), Handshakers,
 1165:             length(Parents), Parents]),
 1166:     if
 1167:         length(Handshakers)>0 ->
 1168:             lists:foreach(fun(P) -> exit(P,some_reason) end, Parents),
 1169:             ct:log("After sending exits; now going to sleep", []),
 1170:             timer:sleep((SleepSec+15)*1000),
 1171:             ct:log("After sleeping", []),
 1172:             ssh_info:print(fun ct:log/2),
 1173:             {Parents2, Conns2, Handshakers2} =
 1174:                 ssh_test_lib:find_handshake_parent(ssh_test_lib:server_port(Config)),
 1175:             ct:log("Found (Port=~p):~n"
 1176:                    "  Connections  (length ~p): ~p~n"
 1177:                    "  Handshakers  (length ~p): ~p~n"
 1178:                    "  with parents (length ~p): ~p",
 1179:                    [ssh_test_lib:server_port(Config),
 1180:                     length(Conns2), Conns2,
 1181:                     length(Handshakers2), Handshakers2,
 1182:                     length(Parents2), Parents2]),
 1183:             if
 1184:                 Handshakers2==[] andalso Conns2==Conns0 ->
 1185:                     ok;
 1186:                 Handshakers2=/=[] ->
 1187:                     ct:log("Handshakers still alive: ~p", [Handshakers2]),
 1188:                     {fail, handshakers_alive};
 1189:                 true ->
 1190:                     ct:log("Connections before: ~p~n"
 1191:                            "Connections after: ~p", [Conns0,Conns2]),
 1192:                     {fail, connections_bad}
 1193:             end;
 1194: 
 1195:         true ->
 1196:             {fail, no_handshakers}
 1197:     end.
 1198: 
 1199: 
 1200: %%%================================================================
 1201: %%%==== Internal functions ========================================
 1202: %%%================================================================
 1203: 
 1204: chk_pref_algs(Config,
 1205:               ExpectedKex,
 1206:               ExpectedCiphers,
 1207:               ServerPrefOpts) ->
 1208:     %% Start the daemon
 1209:     case ssh_test_lib:daemon(
 1210:                       [{send_ext_info,false},
 1211:                        {recv_ext_info,false},
 1212:                        {system_dir, system_dir(Config)}
 1213:                        | ServerPrefOpts])
 1214:     of
 1215:         {_,Host,Port} ->
 1216:             %% Check the Kex part
 1217:             ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec(
 1218:               [{set_options, [print_ops, {print_messages,detail}]},
 1219:                {connect, Host, Port,
 1220:                 [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1221:                  {user_dir, user_dir(Config)},
 1222:                  {user_interaction, false}
 1223:                 ]},
 1224:                {send, hello},
 1225:                receive_hello,
 1226:                {match,
 1227:                 #ssh_msg_kexinit{
 1228:                    kex_algorithms = to_lists(ExpectedKex),
 1229:                    encryption_algorithms_server_to_client = to_lists(ExpectedCiphers),
 1230:                    _   = '_'},
 1231:                 receive_msg}
 1232:               ]);
 1233:         Error ->
 1234:             Error
 1235:     end.
 1236: 
 1237: 
 1238: filter_supported(K, Algs) -> Algs -- (Algs--supported(K)).
 1239: 
 1240: supported(_K) -> proplists:get_value(
 1241:                    server2client,
 1242:                    ssh_transport:supported_algorithms(cipher)).
 1243: 
 1244: to_lists(L) -> lists:map(fun erlang:atom_to_list/1, L).
 1245:     
 1246: 
 1247: %%%---- init_suite and end_suite ---------------------------------------	
 1248: start_apps(Config) ->
 1249:     catch ssh:stop(),
 1250:     ok = ssh:start(),
 1251:     Config.
 1252: 
 1253: stop_apps(_Config) ->
 1254:     ssh:stop().
 1255: 
 1256: 
 1257: setup_dirs(Config) ->
 1258:     ct:log("Pub keys setup for: ~p",
 1259:            [ssh_test_lib:setup_all_user_host_keys(Config)]),
 1260:     Config.
 1261: 
 1262: system_dir(Config) -> filename:join(proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config), system).
 1263: 
 1264: user_dir(Config) -> proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config).
 1265: 
 1266: %%%----------------------------------------------------------------
 1267: start_std_daemon(Config) ->	
 1268:     start_std_daemon(Config, []).
 1269: 
 1270: start_std_daemon(Config, ExtraOpts) ->
 1271:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config), 
 1272:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
 1273:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1274:     UserPasswords = [{"user1","pwd1"}],
 1275:     Options = [%%{preferred_algorithms,[{public_key,['ssh-rsa']}]}, %% For some test cases
 1276: 	       {system_dir, system_dir(Config)},
 1277: 	       {user_dir, UserDir},
 1278: 	       {user_passwords, UserPasswords},
 1279: 	       {failfun, fun ssh_test_lib:failfun/2}
 1280: 	       | ExtraOpts],
 1281:     Ref = {Server, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon(Options),
 1282:     ct:log("Std server ~p started at ~p:~p~nOptions=~p",[Server, Host, Port, Options]),
 1283:     [{server,Ref}, {user_passwords, UserPasswords} | Config].
 1284: 
 1285: 
 1286: stop_std_daemon(Config) ->
 1287:     ssh:stop_daemon(ssh_test_lib:server_pid(Config)),
 1288:     ct:log("Std server ~p at ~p:~p stopped",
 1289:            [ssh_test_lib:server_pid(Config), ssh_test_lib:server_host(Config),
 1290:             ssh_test_lib:server_port(Config)]),
 1291:     lists:keydelete(server, 1, Config).
 1292: 
 1293: 
 1294: check_std_daemon_works(Config, Line) ->
 1295:     case std_connect(Config) of
 1296: 	{ok,C} ->
 1297: 	    ct:log("Server ~p:~p ~p is ok at line ~p",
 1298: 		   [ssh_test_lib:server_host(Config), ssh_test_lib:server_port(Config),
 1299: 		    ssh_test_lib:server_pid(Config), Line]),
 1300: 	    ok = ssh:close(C),
 1301: 	    Config;
 1302: 	Error = {error,_} ->
 1303: 	    ct:fail("Standard server ~p:~p ~p is ill at line ~p: ~p",
 1304: 		    [ssh_test_lib:server_host(Config), ssh_test_lib:server_port(Config),
 1305: 		     ssh_test_lib:server_pid(Config), Line, Error])
 1306:     end.
 1307: 
 1308: server_user_password(Config) -> server_user_password(1, Config).
 1309: 
 1310: server_user_password(N, Config) -> lists:nth(N, ?v(user_passwords,Config)).
 1311: 
 1312: std_connect(Config) ->
 1313:     std_connect({ssh_test_lib:server_host(Config),
 1314:                  ssh_test_lib:server_port(Config)}, Config).
 1315: 
 1316: std_connect({Host,Port}, Config) ->
 1317:     std_connect({Host,Port}, Config, []).
 1318: 
 1319: std_connect({Host,Port}, Config, Opts) ->
 1320:     std_connect(Host, Port, Config, Opts).
 1321: 
 1322: std_connect(Host, Port, Config, Opts) ->
 1323:     {User,Pwd} = server_user_password(Config),
 1324:     ssh:connect(Host, Port, 
 1325: 		%% Prefer User's Opts to the default opts
 1326: 		[O || O = {Tag,_} <- [{user,User},{password,Pwd},
 1327: 				      {silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1328:                                       {save_accepted_host, false},
 1329: 				      {user_dir, user_dir(Config)},
 1330: 				      {user_interaction, false}],
 1331: 		      not lists:keymember(Tag, 1, Opts)
 1332: 		] ++ Opts,
 1333: 		30000).
 1334:     
 1335: %%%----------------------------------------------------------------	
 1336: connect_and_kex(Config) ->
 1337:     connect_and_kex(Config, ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec([]) ).
 1338: 
 1339: connect_and_kex(Config, InitialState) ->
 1340:     ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec(
 1341:       [{connect,
 1342: 	ssh_test_lib:server_host(Config),ssh_test_lib:server_port(Config),
 1343: 	[{preferred_algorithms,[{kex,[?DEFAULT_KEX]},
 1344:                                 {cipher,?DEFAULT_CIPHERS}
 1345:                                ]},
 1346:          {silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1347:          {recv_ext_info, false},
 1348: 	 {user_dir, user_dir(Config)},
 1349: 	 {user_interaction, false}
 1350:          | proplists:get_value(extra_options,Config,[])
 1351:         ]},
 1352:        receive_hello,
 1353:        {send, hello},
 1354:        {send, ssh_msg_kexinit},
 1355:        {match, #ssh_msg_kexinit{_='_'}, receive_msg},
 1356:        {send, ssh_msg_kexdh_init},
 1357:        {match,# ssh_msg_kexdh_reply{_='_'}, receive_msg},
 1358:        {send, #ssh_msg_newkeys{}},
 1359:        {match, #ssh_msg_newkeys{_='_'}, receive_msg}
 1360:       ],
 1361:       InitialState).
 1362: 
 1363: %%%----------------------------------------------------------------
 1364: 
 1365: %%% For matching peer disconnection
 1366: disconnect() ->
 1367:     disconnect('_').
 1368: 
 1369: disconnect(Code) ->
 1370:     {'or',[#ssh_msg_disconnect{code = Code,
 1371: 			       _='_'},
 1372: 	   tcp_closed,
 1373: 	   {tcp_error,econnaborted}
 1374: 	  ]}.
 1375: 
 1376: %%%----------------------------------------------------------------
 1377: connect_and_userauth_request(Host, Port, User, Pwd, UserDir) ->
 1378:     ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec(
 1379:           [{set_options, [print_ops, print_messages]},
 1380:            {connect,Host,Port,
 1381:             [{preferred_algorithms,[{kex,[?DEFAULT_KEX]},
 1382:                                     {cipher,?DEFAULT_CIPHERS}
 1383:                                    ]},
 1384:              {silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1385:              {recv_ext_info, false},
 1386:              {user_dir, UserDir},
 1387:              {user_interaction, false}
 1388:             ]},
 1389:            receive_hello,
 1390:            {send, hello},
 1391:            {send, ssh_msg_kexinit},
 1392:            {match, #ssh_msg_kexinit{_='_'}, receive_msg},
 1393:            {send, ssh_msg_kexdh_init},
 1394:            {match,# ssh_msg_kexdh_reply{_='_'}, receive_msg},
 1395:            {send, #ssh_msg_newkeys{}},
 1396:            {match, #ssh_msg_newkeys{_='_'}, receive_msg},
 1397:            {send, #ssh_msg_service_request{name = "ssh-userauth"}},
 1398: 	   {match, #ssh_msg_service_accept{name = "ssh-userauth"}, receive_msg},
 1399: 	   {send, #ssh_msg_userauth_request{user = User,
 1400: 					    service = "ssh-connection",
 1401: 					    method = "password",
 1402: 					    data = <<?BOOLEAN(?FALSE),
 1403: 						     ?STRING(unicode:characters_to_binary(Pwd))>>
 1404: 					   }}
 1405:           ]).
 1406: 
 1407: trpt_test_lib_send_disconnect(State) ->
 1408:     ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec(
 1409:       [{send, #ssh_msg_disconnect{code = ?SSH_DISCONNECT_BY_APPLICATION,
 1410:                                   description = "End of the fun",
 1411:                                   language = ""
 1412:                                  }},
 1413:        close_socket
 1414:       ], State).
